channel.title: Some questions
channel.description:
Well I was just wondering.. Would it be safe buying these two items http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/searchtools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=4786531&csid=ITD&body=MAIN#detailspecs http://www.newegg.com/Special/ShellShocker.aspx
From those stores? I've heard a few stories about tigerdirect but I think newegg is 100% legit. Thanks

item.title: Some questions
item.dc:creator: @cows_be_sacred cows_be_sacred
item.description:
@cows_be_sacred wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:7, topic:295985”][quote author=cows_be_sacred link=topic=392012.msg2918873#msg2918873 date=1250635281]

Probably, if you have better resources (shops) I’d go there first.

Bestbuy and other stores around where I live over price by a landslide.

Graphics card on newegg - $106.99
Bestbuy - $111.99
[Which actually is pretty near $6 isn’t too bad]

Psu on newegg - $69.99 [650w]
Bestbuy -$89.99 [500w]
Bestbuy - $109.99+ [650w]

So I’m actually saving a lot more as COD4 comes with the graphics card. Also I’m pretty sure you get a discount on newegg if you exceed $150.00.

Graphic card - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814150316
PSU - http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16817702018

I think these are good. If anyone can update me on some better deals?
[/quote]
i didnt think people even considered stores like best buy for computer parts…[/quote]
Yes but I live in a suburb and there is only one computer store in my town which is terrible [e.g. - win 95 256mb ram, 6 gig hdd, pentium processor, 1 floppy slot, no usb slots] and bestbuy is the next closest thing. 30 minute drive anyway. Nothing else for 1+ hour drive so…

Just as a side note

-40gig hard drive at that store is $79.99
-160gig - $99.99
-250gig -$110.00
-360gig - $120.00

Read full topic
